meanings.definition: The quality or state of being canonical.
meanings.sent1: The canonicity of the text ensured its place in the official collection.
meanings.sent2: In literature, canonicity often determines which works are considered classics.
meanings.sent3: The debate over the canonicity of the ancient manuscript led to some humorous misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her adherence to the rules of etiquette was of such canonicity that it became a running joke among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The canonicity of the recipe was unquestionable, passed down through generations with no alterations.

meanings.definition: The status of being accepted as part of a canon, especially in religious or literary contexts.
meanings.sent1: The canonicity of the religious text was crucial for its authority within the community.
meanings.sent2: The canonicity of the novel was debated among scholars for years.
meanings.sent3: The canonicity of the new play caused quite a stir in the theater world.
meanings.sent4: His canonicity as a poet was solidified when his works were included in the prestigious anthology.
meanings.sent5: The canonicity of the painting was evident in its prominent display at the museum.
